cards.shortmeaning: The Seven of Swords warns that there could be manipulative or dishonest behaviour at play. Whilst this is often to protect ourselves or others; at times it isn’t justifiable. Analyse the motives of the people involved, including you, to know which is applicable right now.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject should be mindful of the information they are sharing and the people they are associating with. The Subject, or someone around them, may be required to adopt underhand methods to achieve something they want and the Subject is in an uncomfortable situation where behaviours and actions may not be what they seem. Someone is misleading someone else even if the motivation behind it is sound.  This needs to be handled sensitively and the Subject cannot simply demand or apply pressure to get to the bottom of what’s really going on. It may be that it is the Subject who, for what seems to be very good reasons, is the one who is not being honest, or trying to manipulate the situation, and when the truth finally comes out they will need to consider whether the end justifies the means. Depending on the nature of the question posed by the Subject, this card could be a warning that they may be being manipulated by someone else.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Eight of Swords
cards.description: Being driven by fear and feeling unable to act
cards.shortmeaning: With the Eight of Swords you have a decision to make but you fear the consequences that will prevail. You’re left feeling trapped and unable to act. Delaying it further will only worsen the situation for you now. Accepting you have played a part in creating this situation might help you to find a potential solution.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject has allowed a very difficult, tense situation to build over time and they fear it is finally about to break open. They are now caught between two factions and any decision will have some negative consequence. The Subject feels there will be hurt and loss, either way, and will be distressed about this. They need encouragement to face and deal with it before the situation gets any worse. The Subject is at least partly responsible for this issue, and the message here is that they need to take decisive action. There’s no point in spending any more time in despair and worry – they must now try to improve their state of mind. They’d benefit most from thinking through the best ways of dealing with the situation, or even sorting it out directly, rather than fretting about it.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Nine of Swords
cards.description: Suffering and anxiety, a fresh mental perspective is needed
cards.shortmeaning: The Nine of Swords shows personal suffering through fear, grief or guilt. Destructive tendencies come to the fore as you punish yourself for the choices you have made. The reality really isn’t as bad as you imagine. Adopt a more positive mind-set to move forward.
cards.longmeaning: The Nine of Swords crops up when the Subject’s mental attitude can improve, or worsen, a situation and it can illustrate self-destructive, depressive tendencies and thoughts. This card will indicate some issues that need to be dealt with but the situation is not quite as hopeless as the Subject feels. It is likely that they are allowing their fears and concerns to become overblown, and may have misplaced feelings of guilt or anxiety. The Subject’s situation and life will brighten considerably when they allow themselves to move past this way of thinking. It is in their control. They should try talking to people close to them, or who are involved in the situation, then the Subject might start to realise that other people have a less judgemental attitude to them than they think.
cards.notesonimage: Swords are pointing and crossing every which way indicating confusion, worry, fear and the feeling of conflict, and the clouds are turbulent and stormy.  However, the two Swords at the top are lying flat and aligned neatly – indicating things are not as bad as you think, don’t allow your own thoughts to dictate how you are managing – talking to others might alleviate some of these anxieties.

cards.name: Ten of Swords
cards.description: Bitter and difficult endings, still trying to accept what has happened
cards.shortmeaning: A difficult situation comes to an abrupt end when the Ten of Swords appears and it pretty much leave you feeling devastated. The truth is finally out and you now accept something you didn’t before. At least you are now freed from the restraints and difficulties of this situation so try to pick yourself up, dust yourself off and move on.
cards.longmeaning: The suffering of the Subject inherent in this card is similar to the Three of Swords and they will feel upset, hurt, exposed and even heart-broken. But, with the Ten of Swords, the Subject has gained understanding and acceptance that they may have been wrong or that they have been in denial about it. Whether a forced change or not, this is the bitter ending of a situation. The message with this card is that, now the truth of the situation is faced, it has to end. The Subject will be able to set new challenges and embark on a new, happier life, free from the hurt and anxiety depicted in this card. Things will start to get better, one day at a time. The Subject should dedicate their time and energy to what is before them, new horizons, rather than on what has passed which will hold them back.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Page of Swords
cards.description: Be wary of seemingly idle chit chat that could back lash or childish behaviour
cards.shortmeaning: Be careful of how and who you talk to. Your new viewpoint will lead you to question people and situations around you. If you share this, your words could be blown out of proportion when repeated by others. You know your intentions but they’re open to interpretation.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject may have a new or changing standpoint or attitude to do with something in their lives, but they need to be careful when sharing their thoughts with other people. The Subject’s new way of thinking is exactly that – new -and may not be quite formed enough to project onto the outside world without receiving criticism. The Subject should think about whether they have been, or are being, just a little too loose-lipped about something.  Because of their new attitude they may be saying things in a way that could be taken out of context when passed on by someone else. The Subject could also feel that they are a victim to gossip or rumour and, again, it could just be a case of misinterpretation. The main advice is to be careful in their dialogue for now, either with their own words, or to avoid misinterpreting the meanings of what other people are saying; they should also avoid being too sharp tongued or spiteful.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Knight of Swords
cards.description: A chaotic, driven young man who may not think things through carefully
cards.shortmeaning: A young and impetuous male that you find rather charming bears an influence on you now. Be wary as he will act with superficial knowledge of a situation. He is quick to change opinion and therefore direction, meaning he could leave your life as quickly as he entered it.
cards.longmeaning: In a situation, the Knight represents a hasty change of opinion, or a knee jerk reaction, to someone or something in the Subject’s life. There is a lot of energy and movement with this card and they may be impatient for things to move on. The Subject should consider if there are loose ends to be tied up, or responsibilities to be seen to, before they gallop down off down their new path. As a person the Knight is clever, witty, talented and energetic. He is easy to admire and everyone wants to be involved or associated with him. He is not very mature, though, and has little in the way of consistency and dependability, unless it suits him at that time. His opinions and beliefs are flighty because he has no real experience to draw on and so his opinions, beliefs and allegiances, continually fluctuate. These characteristics are damaging to his personal relationships and hard on people who come to rely on him. The Knight regularly hurts people and, as soon as he perceives a situation has become stale or boring, he will move on.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Queen of Swords
cards.description: A guarded but intelligent woman who it takes time to get to know
cards.shortmeaning: A strong, intelligent, aloof woman who bears pain and sorrow without showing it. A dignified character with high expectations designed to protect her from her vulnerability and hurt. It could be that these are qualities you need to develop in your current situation but be aware of disassociating from your feelings entirely.
cards.longmeaning: The Queen of Swords is an impressive character because of her faculty of mind. Not just in the sense that she is intelligent, quick witted and knowledgeable, which she is, but because she has learned to control her emotional reactions. She does this by managing her expectations through reason and clarity of thought, she also understands that allowing emotions to overcome sense and logic is often unproductive. She can appear detached and stand-offish, because she keeps her emotions under control. People that don’t know her well could perceive her as arrogant and haughty, but she is not. She can be as sensitive as, say, the Queen of Cups, but past experience has taught her to keep it from view. She knows herself and what causes her hurt, and she will manage and organise her personal life to make sure she does not fall foul of it again.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: King of Swords
cards.description: An impressingly intelligent and knowledgable man
cards.shortmeaning: A highly logical and intelligent, mature man who can be rather dismissive of emotion.  He is clever and incisive, able to get straight to the heart of a problem, and find the right solution.  You can’t be too sensitive around this person, their words can hurt but are often the truth.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject may be dealing with a rather impressive, intelligent man. His intelligence and experience give him the power to do and say the right things at the right time, but, he is a head-rules-the-heart kind of guy, and can lack honest and sincere involvement with those around him. He has many good traits though and he can be kind and helpful. He is always just slightly detached from a situation, or relationship, and he’ll refuse to get in over his head. He’ll do what he perceives is the right thing to do, rather than what he wants to do, because he fears losing control or making mistakes. Not to protect himself from hurt like the Queen of Swords does, but purely on an egotistical level. His intellectual abilities are of the utmost importance to him and, thus, they define him as a person. He can become uneasy in romantic situations and dismissive of sentimentality.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Ace of Wands
cards.description: On a mission to succeed, a new and exciting idea or opportunity
cards.shortmeaning: The Ace of Wands shows you using your creative imagination to form a new vision. This vision is not yet fully refined or defined but there’s an inner pull toward a new adventure or pursuit that sparks your enthusiasm. This may bring about boredom and restlessness with the current state of play and a desire for something new and exciting.
cards.longmeaning: Something has sparked the Subject’s interest. At this stage, they won’t have the full idea or all the facts and figures needed to evidence its real potential. They do know however, that it has real promise and warrants more attention. The Ace of Wands is the birth of a vision, a new idea or vocation. The Subject is analysing something in more depth and is realising it may have more potential than they first thought. Not only that, it’s developing a hunger to pursue this further in the Subject. The Subject is impatient to move forward and may be frustrated living in the here and now. They want to embark on their new journey straight away but they will have to wait for the opportunity to grow into something more concrete.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Two of Wands
cards.description: Look carefully for a solution, answers lie with new ideas or opportunities
cards.shortmeaning: You should take a closer look at an opportunity or idea that has emerged. It provides solutions where they are most needed and makes it possible to progress current situations.
cards.longmeaning: An opportunity has come to the fore and the Subject should make sure it is given its due and careful attention. It may not be fully defined, with certain details yet to be ascertained. The Subject’s interest has been roused and they know that this could be an advantageous prospect. At the start of any business, project or journey there are things that need to be planned and set in place before you head off. In all of the suits, the Two can be viewed as a manifestation of the energy and movement depicted by the Aces. The Subject is able to see a new direction forming and has the resources and skills needed to move ahead. This is a card of progression and bodes well for the subject and their endeavours.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Three of Wands
cards.description: Skills and achievement, encouraging signs, progression
cards.shortmeaning: An achievement of some description, the first hurdle overcome. This isn’t the final outcome, you’re pretty much still at the starting blocks. Nevertheless, this is an important stage on your journey; celebrate and be proud of yourself.
cards.longmeaning: This is the first Wands card to portray real achievement. Something has come to fruition and the Subject has managed to manifest an idea into reality. The wants and aspirations depicted by the Wands cards are not always feasible or realistic. They may take the Subject’s fancy but ultimately come to nothing. Not with the Three, though, and that’s why it’s such a positive card. It shows a project/venture or pursuit that has sparked the passion of the Subject, but, moreover, that the Subject has actually been able to show there is something very sound about it. This is obviously a fulfilling experience and will drive the Subject on to do, and achieve, more. They should be mindful that the Three is still an “early stage” card. The situation as it is now will change and develop. It’s likely that there are challenges and hurdles to overcome but, for now, they should be feeling happy and excited about what is ahead of them.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Four of Wands
cards.description: Hard work, persistance, commitment to a goal
cards.shortmeaning: Your dedication and hard work is starting to pay off when the Four of Wands graces your reading. Take a moment to relax and appreciate your successes before forging ahead again. You have a firm foundation and all the support and tools you need to keep succeeding.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject is doing very well at the moment and has made fair progress toward achieving some aim or aspiration. The Subject has worked hard to establish or develop something and has created a solid base to work from. Whilst this card may not have the outward celebrations and gratification portrayed by the Three or the Six it is still a very important card. Here, the Subject needs to take stock and notice just how far they’ve come. They should not undervalue their progress and efforts, or overlook the significance of their achievement. By taking stock, they will gain a better understanding of what they’re capable of achieving in the future. They have managed to secure the buy-in they needed, and they’re supported by the people around them. They may to start to realise their successes could go beyond their wildest expectations.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Five of Wands
cards.description: Obstacles and limitations are holding back progress
cards.shortmeaning: The Five of Wands shows that certain obstacles, most likely physical or material limitations, will make you feel as if you won’t reach your goal. You have the ability to find new ways of doing things you just need to think outside the box; if you can, you will stay on course.
cards.longmeaning: All the Fives represent restrictions or constraints, where the Subject can’t have, or quite do, what they want. The Five of Wands  indicates that the Subject is held back, or hindered, from achieving something they have set out to do, and feel passionate about. It could be a long held dream, or vocation, and they’re unsure how they’ll be able to succeed now. There are always setbacks in life and it can be easy to find reasons and excuses to believe something is no longer worth the time and effort needed to achieve it. The ability to move past this hurdle lies firmly with the Subject. If this is something they are passionate about and have committed to, they can prevail.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Six of Wands
cards.description: A significant achievement, pride in a job well done
cards.shortmeaning: The Six of Wands shows a significant achievement on your part. Success that is recognised and endorsed by others, even those that may have previously doubted you and your choices. A very happy, pleasing time for you. Well done!
cards.longmeaning: The achievements referred to here, in the Six of Wands, are more accomplished than those referred to in the Three. Not only has the Subject managed to succeed, they also know that they chose the right path and they are right where they want to be. The Subject should have boundless confidence in their abilities and a real sense of pride. There will still be a lot of movement and progression around the Subject. This is not a time to stand still and there may be a plan and/or an option or desire to travel. They now know for sure that they can see things through, work hard, and survive when things get tough. This is the card of adventures and quests and the Subject is a willing participant. There’s not much that can hold them back at this point.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Seven of Wands
cards.description: Tiredness. A lack of motivation for key projects and endeavours
cards.shortmeaning: The Seven of Wands shows that enthusiasm or motivation for your journey has waned. Perhaps you’re finding it difficult to stay focussed and committed to your goal. Revisit plans objectively to see where alterations could reignite your creative passion and spur you on. A change is as good as a break – so the saying goes.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject is struggling to retain their passionate attachment to someone, or something they are working on, in their life. There could be a number of reasons why – they may be lacking support, or they have become disillusioned and unexcited about the future and its possibilities. The Subject really needs to think this through; a decision has to be taken regarding this issue – should they come away from this relationship/situation?  Or should they make a real effort to change their attitude and inject some enthusiasm back into it? They should not ignore it, however, because it will create additional problems and, as a result, they will become more detached than ever. Instead they need to focus on finding a way to restore their appetite for the situation, or come away from it, in order to drive things forward.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Eight of Wands
cards.description: A renewed fire and spirit. In a creative flow
cards.shortmeaning: The Eight of Wands shows that you have faced and come through some obstacle and as a result, your passion is reignited and you’re raring to go. Creative ability is released and you are surrounded with opportunities to move forward. A busy and challenging but immensely productive time.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject is very much in their creative flow and there are bucket-loads of energy with this card. The Subject is putting a huge amount of effort and enthusiasm into the job at hand. There will be all sorts of activity happening around them and everything seems be leading to the same destination. This situation hasn’t always been so positive, and the Subject has had to overcome various trials and tribulations to get to this stage. They don’t need to worry about that right now, because they are very much where they want, and need, to be. They’re driven and motivated and ready to take on the world.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Nine of Wands
cards.description: Exhaustion. A need to dig deep, not long now
cards.shortmeaning: The Nine of Wands is the card of struggling on! You’re tired and exhausted having worked long and hard to get to this point. You are near to completing your journey, to achieving your goal, don’t give up now. You have the strength and determination to clear this last hurdle.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject could be at the end of their tether with a situation they feel should already have come to an end. The Nine of Wands is the penultimate step in the Subject’s journey but they don’t feel they have the energy to carry on. Whilst they’re facing incredibly high expectations, they should have faith that they have the capacity to see things through. Yes, it has been a long and hard journey, but it would be a shame to give up now. The Subject would benefit from looking at this situation as if it were the last leg of a race, where the sprint at the end could win the race, rather than slowing down towards the tape. This last task or obstacle is not a deal breaker. There are people around the Subject that believe in them, and who can offer support and encouragement if they know it is needed, or the Subject should be encouraged to summon up the strength from deep within to overcome this last hurdle.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Ten of Wands
cards.description: Overburdened, taken on too much, something needs to give
cards.shortmeaning: The Ten of Wands shows that you are over burdened from taking on too much. You need to reassess your situation and prioritise your to-do-list. You will need to relinquish some of your responsibilities; there is only so much you can do alone.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject has taken on more than they can chew and they’re feeling overloaded. At the culmination of the Wands journey, there should be a lot to celebrate about – something has been established – but the subject can’t see this because it is too much of a burden. Despite the success of having achieved what they set out to do, something now needs to ‘give’; and, moving forward, the Subject needs to weigh up what they take on, against their capacity to actually do it. The Subject may also feel overwhelmed by someone else’s troubles and upset; they may be feeling, in some way, responsible for it, or that they should, but are unable, to assist. The Subject may want to help but they are too involved to see clearly what needs to be done. This card may nudge them to stand back a little in order to observe the situation objectively in order to find a way to help.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Page of Wands
cards.description: Passion around a creative idea that needs some refinement
cards.shortmeaning: Your creative idea is gathering substance although it is embryonic. Your passion is great but a dose of reality may be needed. Seek comment and discussion from those you trust. Don’t let realists dampen your enthusiasm; there is potential, but hear the objective point of view to create an attainable goal.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject is attracted to something, new and they may be talking about changing direction as a result. They are very excited by this new idea/prospect but they need to be careful of making hasty and unrealistic decisions, or acting without due care and thought. As the Subject starts to talk to people, and relay their interest in this new pursuit there will be people who may be dismissive of it. They will critique it and the Subject may feel as if they are trying to discredit it,  but they should turn a negative into a positive by listening to their comments and using them constructively. What really matters is the ‘action’ the Subject takes. Using any information the Subject has received, negative or positive, they should be assessing the idea to see how it can evolve into something more realistic and feasible. Wanting to run with an idea would be typical of a Wands person, as they are confident and ambitious, but rushing into endeavours without due thought and consideration would not be constructive, and again, the Page portrays an immature attitude to something which would benefit from research.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Knight of Wands
cards.description: An impulsive, unpredictable male, eternally young at heart
cards.shortmeaning: A young and impulsive male eternally searching for another quest, another adventure. He will never find normality fulfilling; always desiring something out of the ordinary. As a knight in shining armour he is easy to fall in love with. Be mindful though, it his love of adventure that is attractive; a relationship between you could prove difficult.
cards.longmeaning: The Knight of Wands is immensely seductive and it is very difficult to escape his charm. The Subject may have met or become involved with a young man who is rather unpredictable and spontaneous. It is these characteristics: his love of life, adventure and passion that draw people close to him. The Knight will head in to any situation without any real concern for the consequences of his actions and that is what makes him quite a dangerous figure. Although this Knight is attractive and admirable, if he stays around, he could prove to be a bit of a disappointment. The initial attraction and charm is superficial. Commitment and routine do not bring out the best in him. He constantly has one eye on the opportunities open to him and he’s a ‘never say never’ kind of person. If the Knight comes up to represent the Subject they may be tempted to set off on some new journey or take up some new, adventurous pursuit.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Queen of Wands
cards.description: A confident, capable woman. Incredibly loyal and talented
cards.shortmeaning: A confident and capable woman who can turn her hand to anything and excel. She commits herself entirely, offering unrivalled support but only to those things or people that matter most. You have the same qualities and attributes but should learn something about focussing them where they are truly needed or have maximum impact.
cards.longmeaning: The woman represented by this card is highly creative, productive and warm. She is incredibly loyal to the causes, people and situations she involves herself with. She is also talented – she can turn her hand to a wide range of tasks and duties and she completes them all well and to the best of her ability. Not only is she competent and able to create, she is a hard, diligent worker who will see things through to the bitter end. As such, she is immensely helpful to have around when things need to get done. This card can appear when the Subject has committed to something important to them. It could be a vocation, business venture or career move. They will need to channel their energies and adopt a wide range of skills to bring the project together or to achieve what it is they desire. People around the Subject are very proud of them and, perhaps, surprised at what the Subject has already been able to achieve. With a set of skills, and the capabilities, of the Queen of Wands, the possibilities are limitless.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: King of Wands
cards.description: A leader, a man in a position of authority, happiest when faced with a challenge
cards.shortmeaning: An ambitious, dynamic leader, able to inspire and make things happen. He will help turn your ideas into reality; taking it to levels you’d never considered. He gets bored easily though and so won’t be around for the duration. To make best use of his input, learn something about his attributes so you can adopt them when he has moved on.
cards.longmeaning: The King of Wands is full of ambition, he is not scared of taking risks and is in a position of power and authority. He has a solid character and can influence people, events and the environment around him. He is a true leader; he inspires and is happiest when he is on an adventure, fighting a battle or trying to conquer something. He thrives on challenges and is not content with humdrum life. He will get bored if bogged down in routine and doesn’t like performing to the same tune as anyone else. The Subject may be inspired by a man who has come into their life. They should be careful though, because the other side to the King is that he can be quite ruthless. He sees only the end goal and does not spend long considering what he loses along the way. If this card appears to represent the Subject, they are asked to drive something forward, to take the lead and make something a success. They are passionate and have the knowledge and experience to take on the challenge ahead of them. It is time for them to come into their own.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Ace of Pentacles
cards.description: Holding out for a gift, bonus or loan to establish something
cards.shortmeaning: You are considering an investment or waiting for a gift or loan you hope will improve your financial situation. Opportunities will arise; you will need to capitalise on them to achieve longer term change to material fortune.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject has an idea or opportunity to manifest something that could change their material position. This could be an exciting time where the Subject feels capable of achieving something real in world that can be seen, recognised and endorsed by friends, family and peers. As with all the Aces, this is embryonic and there is a lot of work and research that needs to be done before the potential in this situation becomes a reality. The energy is the Aces is strong, and because the Pentacles suit is very much more grounded, this idea or opportunity has real promise. The Subject should not allow negativity or criticism to dampen their enthusiasm about it. For now, they should spend time developing the idea and gathering information and resources needed to see it through.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Two of Pentacles
cards.description: Opportunities on offer to overcome financial issues
cards.shortmeaning: Partnerships, or working arrangements on offer, can help you overcome financial difficulties. You don’t need to do this alone so accept help and make best use of it. Money can make money, be clever with what you are given.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject is in a situation where they could be offered the money or resources for their project. They may have an offer to form a partnership of some sort that will help them to achieve something on a material or financial level. In the Ace, the Subject is presented by an idea, or an opportunity that has potential. When the Two appears, this idea or potential starts to mobilise and come to life. The Subject won’t have everything they need in terms of support or finance to do as they please. They have, or are about to receive, an injection of cash, support or advice that will help them establish something new or achieve something they have been aiming towards. They need to use this help carefully to make sure it is invested in the right way, so it will have maximum, long term, benefits for them. It definitely should not be undervalued or frittered away.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Three of Pentacles
cards.description: Some positive material change or step forward, celebrate
cards.shortmeaning: Early signs of success relating to some venture or investment that could be making money now or in the future. This project is in its infancy. Further work and dedication will yield more significant, permanent rewards.
cards.longmeaning: Things are going well for the Subject at work, or with regard to some material change. There is a sense of confidence about a new job, or business, and the current situation indicates that the right decisions have been taken until now. The Subject won’t know what the final outcome is, nor what the ultimate conclusion or achievement will be. That will only become clear with time. This card validates the initial undertaking of this opportunity and the hard work that has led to this first manifestation of success; it has proven to be good, the future looks bright and the Subject should feel content. Because this is not the final outcome, merely a prelude to ultimate goal, the Subject needs to use this message as a motivator to keep up the momentum, rather than a sign that they can take their foot off the pedal. The positive message conveyed with this card should further enthuse and energise the Subject to continue their efforts to achieve more substantial, enduring rewards.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Four of Pentacles
cards.description: Avoiding risk or challenge, clinging on to the norm for fear of loss
cards.shortmeaning: You fear losing your financial security and stability and avoid taking material risks. It is right to be cautious with money and assess risk. Be open to opportunity though; a chance to change your fortune could pass you by.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject may be feeling a little insecure at the moment, fearing change or upheaval in their life. They may feel proud and happy with what they have achieved up to now and are desperately clinging on to it, unprepared to take a risk or do anything out of the norm. They are right to feel happy and proud of what they have achieved, but it is not always good to just hold on to what they’ve got, the Subject could be missing out on something great if they can just open up a little. Whilst it is right to protect what we have built up, and maintain levels of security that make us happy and confident in life, by focusing solely on what we already have, we could be leaving no room for anything new to come into our lives, which is not healthy. The Subject will be avoiding risks and opportunities and, as such, could overlook the chance to attain something that is ultimately better than what they already have.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Five of Pentacles
cards.description: Financial and security issues crop up causing a fair amount of concern
cards.shortmeaning: You are experiencing financial difficulty, and loss, that affects your stability. Unfortunately, you have your sense of self-value tied up in the material things you don’t have, or have lost, resulting in a lack of faith in yourself.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject is experiencing financial difficulties, or issues, that affect their feelings of security such as their home or job. This is likely to be causing anxiety and tension and will be affecting their mind-set and attitude to life on a day to day basis. The really difficult aspect of this card is the resultant effect on the Subject. They have lost confidence in their ability to achieve or to change their fortunes. If the Subject has not looked after their finances properly, and this has caused the current difficulties, they need to learn from that and avoid making the same mistakes in the future. If it has not been their fault, the events leading up to this situation have been unfortunate, but the Subject needs to focus on how they are going to resolve their current circumstance. Their ability to do so will be hindered by their lack of confidence and a chicken and egg situation could ensue. The Reader should work with the Subject to give them the energy and confidence to face up to, and improve, their current predicament.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Six of Pentacles
cards.description: A gift, bonus or loan that helps, feeling positive about people and the future
cards.shortmeaning: An unexpected gift, loan or bonus; you are due to benefit from someone else’s generosity. Your belief in life and people is restored and you feel able to enjoy life more easily, freed from immediate financial concern.
cards.longmeaning: After the difficulties of the Five card, the Six of Pentacles indicates that the Subject is being helped and supported, most likely on a financial, or material, level. It could be a promotion or bonus through work, a financial improvement, or a change to the Subject’s home and, therefore, stability. This card represents unforeseen assistance from another person, or an external force, rather than payment for a job, or task, undertaken by the Subject. The deeper effect of the kindness shown in the Six is that it has a positive influence on the Subject’s overall security and faith in life, not just literally, but on an emotional level too. The Subject’s faith may have been damaged by events in the past, or they may have just started to come out of a very difficult situation which would have been reflected in the Five. When the Six appears, the Subject starts to regain faith and trust in life, and the people around them.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Seven of Pentacles
cards.description: Feeling insecure on some level, a decision about your future is needed
cards.shortmeaning: You face a decision, probably to do with work or a business venture that could potentially affect your financial security and stability. Reflect on the past to know what you want for your future and weigh up priorities carefully.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject is experiencing financial issues, that are affect their feelings of security such as their home or job. This is likely to be causing anxiety and tension and will be affecting their mind-set, and attitude to life, on a day to day basis. The really difficult aspect of this card is the resultant effect on the Subject. They have lost confidence in their ability to achieve, or to change, their fortunes. As with most of the Sevens, this card represents options and choices. Here the Subject has reached a significant goal, but a situation has come about that could threaten their security or financial standing. The Subject has worked hard to get to this point and stands to lose a considerable amount if they make the wrong decision. Likewise, they stand to gain an awful lot if the risk pays off. This card does not indicate which choice is the best one for the Subject, although surrounding cards may nudge the Reader in one direction or another. The advice that does come with this card is that the decision needs to be thought out very carefully. It is acceptable to take risks in life but the decision-making process has to be educated. The Subject needs to consider all the possible ramification,s and weigh them up, in detail.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Eight of Pentacles
cards.description: Dedication to some new undertaking that you hope will bear fruit
cards.shortmeaning: You should learn and develop a new skill or ability which has taken your interest. This vocation or interest is worth pursuing; not only could it yield financial rewards you will actually enjoy and take pleasure in what you do.
cards.longmeaning: When this card appears the Subject is working on something new, or a new element of something they have previously done. This will require learning and studying on their part. However, this is a positive card depicting a worthwhile endeavour that should lead to future gains and success. This pursuit is important to the Subject and they have demonstrated commitment and dedication to it. It is giving them something constructive to focus on and generates excitement for the future. Starting something entirely new or branching off into something different can be daunting, especially if the Subject has come from a secure standing, but it can also revitalise and regenerate the Subject, challenging them to create something new and become more productive than they already are.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Nine of Pentacles
cards.description: Reaping the rewards of hard work and commitment. A time to feel proud
cards.shortmeaning: You are reaping the benefits of your hard work having put your unique skills to efficient use. Be full of confidence and self-worth; these rewards are the direct result of your efforts and capabilities. Be proud of yourself.
cards.longmeaning: There should be a real sense of pride and satisfaction for achieving the contentment symbolised by this card. If the Subject has specifically asked about their financial or material prospects, the outcome looks very positive indeed. The subject is doing well and is able to provide for themselves; feeling content and happy because this card depicts true self sufficiency with a little luxury thrown in. This card focuses on the Subject’s abilities; referring to their specific skills and talents which have been put to good use yielding gratifying results. This happy outcome should be credited directly to the subject because of the effort and determination they have put in to get to this point.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Ten of Pentacles
cards.description: Strong bonds and foundations. A happy fulfilled and secure lifestyle
cards.shortmeaning: Whatever you have been working to create is established and will endure. You are content and happy with your lot. A time to partake in tradition and share emotional or financial inheritance. You enjoy a happy, solid family life.
cards.longmeaning: The Subject should be feeling very secure, happy and content. The Ten of Pentacles is more than just a positive omen for their financial or material fortune, it points to circumstances or achievements that have manifested in physical ways and which have longevity. As such, it can represent buying a home, having established a business, or even a family unit. The Subject has achieved, or created, something that has gathered substance which will continue to grow and develop over time. Money and resources are available to the Subject and they have everything they need to feel happy and secure in life. Their confidence will be riding high; they should savour their successes and continue to tend to the life they have successfully built.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Page of Pentacles
cards.description: Searching for help to do or set-up something. There's a lot to learn yet
cards.shortmeaning: You seek resources to progress an idea that has sparked your interest or enthusiasm. Money and support are available but should be used wisely to have maximum impact. Finance isn’t the only factor though, you also need to learn, and develop your knowledge and skills, to be able to cultivate the idea.
cards.longmeaning: This card represents a concept or idea that, when given time and resources to develop, could grow into a significant opportunity for the Subject. It could be a good business proposition, job offer or interesting prospect which the Subject should consider carefully. At first, it may seem that it is not feasible, and unlikely to materialise, but there is definite potential here. The Subject should be aware that this opportunity is merely notional at this stage, and the final result could look very different to what is being discussed now, as there are other factors which will have an influence on this project. To make this notion a more realistic option, the Subject should seek advice from people they trust who have relevant experience and knowledge and to use any resources offered wisely for maximum impact.  It would also be sensible to also consider doing some actual training or qualifications relevant to the project. There is much for the Subject to learn now.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Knight of Pentacles
cards.description: A responsible, diligent young man. A creature of habit who enjoys routine
cards.shortmeaning: A hard working young man who takes his responsibilities seriously. He will meticulously attend any size task whether important or insignificant. He is reliable but a little boring at times. This person may be able to help you with something now, or else you should consider developing these attributes to achieve your goals.
cards.longmeaning: This Knight represents someone who readily accepts their responsibilities and is willing to work hard to achieve what they want. The Subject may not be currently concerned about long term aims, overly ambitious achievements, or even where their life, or career, is heading. They are in the early stages of their material journey in life and are quite content to start climbing from the bottom rung of the ladder. This Knight should be respected and admired. No matter how young or immature they are, they are aware of their responsibility to contribute something in this life, and to the people around them. If this card has come up to represent someone in the Subject’s life, they will be young, hardworking, reliable and, at times, just a little too happy to follow a routine rather than try something new or take a risk. If the card represents the Subject , then they are working hard and methodically to achieve a level of security, happiness and confidence in life.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: Queen of Pentacles
cards.description: A self-sufficient woman who achieves a lot and seems to have it all
cards.shortmeaning: A self-sufficient woman who recognises her worth and is able to love and honour herself. She prioritises those things she deems important; looking after herself and her love ones financially, spiritually and emotionally. Able to meet her own needs and those of others around her, she is able to make freer choices about who and want she wants in her life. Think about where reliance on others may be holding you back.
cards.longmeaning: It is easy to be jealous of the Queen of Pentacles as she seems to have everything she wants and more. She is an admirable person who is stable and contained. Her relationships are based on quality alone and she will only entertain those people and situations she chooses. She has worked hard to achieve her independence and she rarely has to compromise her needs or make sacrifices to move forward. The Subject may have achieved something of real worth and quality. They will be feeling strong, powerful and in control of their own destiny. The Subject could, finally, be in a position to enjoy the luxuries in life, to be able to indulge in the things they desire. They will not be under financial pressure. The Queen has everything under control. This card might represent someone else in the Subject’s life, and  the Subject would benefit from learning how they have achieved such success. It may be time to take greater responsibility for their life, material fortunes and relationships. The Subject may yearn for a time when they are self-sufficient and not reliant on others to survive and be happy.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO

cards.name: King of Pentacles
cards.description: An authoritative man who's a little risk shy but trustworthy, kind and steady
cards.shortmeaning: A highly successful, authoritative figure you can trust. He has experience overcoming obstacles to manifest things of value in the world and is worthy of the rewards and respect he receives. His ambition yields amazing results without loss of integrity. You may be tasked with establishing something in the world. You will need to seek out guidance and advice where you lack the necessary experience or skills. So, be honest with yourself about your own capabilities; the King of Pentacles learned that through experience.
cards.longmeaning: This card represents a mature man who has excelled on a material and financial level. He also has the authority, wisdom and confidence that comes with having successfully achieved and manifested something in the world. He will be an extremely hard working, diligent character who may be a little averse to risk and doing things differently. He feels his responsibilities keenly and rarely lets anyone down. He has an understanding and methodology that has worked for him in his life and he may be a little rigid in the way he works. When this card appears it may represent someone in the Subject’s life who is financially secure and willing to help. He is stable and trustworthy and extremely good at what he does. Above all he is generous with, and wants to share, his success and to make other people happy. These may be qualities that the Subject finds very attractive, and it may influence them to be more focussed on achieving stability and financial security in their own life.
cards.notesonimage: TO-DO
